summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on C么te d'Ivoire and the subregion, 
Reaffirming commitment to C么te d'Ivoire's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and unity, 
Noting the Secretary-General's letter of 1 February 2006, 
Recalling the expiring mandate of UNMIL on 31 March 2006, 
Concerned at the persistence of the crisis in C么te d'Ivoire, 
Determining the situation in C么te d'Ivoire poses a threat to international peace and security, 

Decides to authorize redeployment of up to one infantry company from UNMIL to UNOCI until 31 March 2006 to provide extra security and perform mandated tasks. 
Intends to review this decision in 30 days and by 31 March 2006. 
Intends to review possible additional troop redeployments between UNMIL and UNOCI. 
Remains actively seized of the matter.
